This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Everyday Sports Injuries
author: DK Publishing
description:
These days, sports are a huge part of our daily lives. Watching them is fun, but taking part in them is even more exciting. Of course, anyone who participates in sports knows that getting hurt is always a possibility. There are more than one million sports-related injuries each year. 
This book is a practical guide to preventing, recognizing, and treating sports injuries. It provides explanations, diagrams, and exercise routines that build strength, speed up recovery, and get you back in the game.

title: Family Power: The True Story of How 'The First Family of Taekwondo' Made Olympic History
author: Mark, Steven, Diana & Jean Lopez
description:
This inspiring sports memoir tells the story of a family united behind a dream. The Lopez family set new records at the Beijing Olympics with three siblings on the same U.S. taekwondo team and a fourth sibling as their coach. Mark took the silver medal, and Steven and Diana both brought home the bronze, with big brother Jean coaching them to victory. 
Told in turns by Steven, Mark, Diana, and Jean, this is the incredible account of how one close-knit family’s boundless determination and rock-solid support system took them from their home in Texas to Olympic glory in Beijing.

title: Family Reunion, Double Fastback
author: Janet Lorimer
description: Tori Wayland has cut herself off from the rest of the Wayland family.  Now her wealthy, and dying, Aunt Stella has summoned her to a family reunion.  There Tori quickly discovers that someone is willing to remove any and all rivals to the Wayland fortune.

title: Fast Company
author: Rich Wallace
description: Manny Ramos is the fastest guy on the Hudson City Youth football team, maybe even the fastest in his school. The new track club seems perfect for him. His light weight could finally be a benefit instead of a curse! When he first sees the enormous indoor sporting complex where he’ll race some of the fastest guys around, Manny is awed. Will his time in the 800 meters be any competition for guys who’ve been racing for years? Manny is determined to put in the time and effort to be a track contender. He’s finally found his sport.

title: Fast Company: Winning Season #3
author: Rich Wallace
description: Manny Ramos is the fastest guy on the Hudson City Youth football team, maybe even the fastest in his school. The new track club seems perfect for him. His light weight could finally be a benefit instead of a curse! When he first sees the enormous indoor sporting complex where he’ll race some of the fastest guys around, Manny is awed. Will his time in the 800 meters be any competition for guys who’ve been racing for years? Manny is determined to put in the time and effort to be a track contender. He’s finally found his sport.

title: Fast Forward, Double Fastback
author: Janice Greene
description: The only time Don Rayburn is truly happy is when he's in his game room using his VCR. Don doesn't know that the new model he's just bought is very special. It will show him things he can't believe, and deliver a final warning he can't ignore.

title: Fear On Ice (A SporTellers Book)
author: Earle Rice, Jr.
description: HOLD EVERYTHING! There seems to be something starting in front of the Oakland net. Cartier is pushing Calder. They both drop their sticks and gloves and put up their hands. Now they're circling each other. Cartier throws a left that misses. Calder starts back with a right. But he STOPPED! Now he's turning his back on Cartier. Calder is skating off the ice!I can't believe it! NEAL CALDER IS SKATING OFF THE ICE!

title: Fins, Wings, and Legs
author: Margaret Clnne, Rachel Griffiths
description: Fish swim. Many birds fly. Some animals use their legs to go fast. Fins, Wings, and Legs tells how animals can move quickly from place to place.

title: Fire from the Rock
author: Sharon Draper
description: Sylvia Patterson is shocked and confused when she is asked to be one of the first black students to attend Central High School. The school is scheduled to be integrated in September 1957, whether the citizens or governor of Arkansas like it or not. Before Sylvia makes her final decision, smoldering racial tension in the town bursts into flame. When the smoke clears, Sylvia sees clearly that nothing is going to stop the change from coming. It is up to her generation to make it happen, in as many different ways as there are colors in the world.

title: First Daughter: My Extreme American Makeover
author: Mitali Perkins
description: This is the second novel about Sameera, the first Pakistani-born First Daughter. In her first adventure, Sameera used her brains and bravado to help her dad win the presidential election. Now she’s living in the White House. She thought life in the White House would be magical but it’s no fairy tale. The Secret Service and the paparazzi follow Sameera everywhere, and she misses her friends and her school back home. So Sameera decides to escape. Will she be able to pull it off, or will her plan backfire on the entire First Family? This smart and funny novel continues the adventures of a Pakistani-American teen in the spotlight.

title: Flight of the Sparrow, Fastback
author: Janice Greene
description: British intelligence knows very little about Yevchenko.  They know he is a Soviet KGB.  His code name is Sparrow, and he is coming their way.  Is he defecting, or is he just another Soviet agent trying to steal whatever secrets he can get his hands on?

title: Flight to Fear
author: Tom Belina
description:
A FLIGHT YOU WILL NEVER FORGET
Red sat in a seat behind the pilot.  "Now…" he said slowly.  "Now I want you to crash this plane into the sea…"
"Are you crazy? You can't ask me to crash my plane into the sea," Captain Willliams said.
"Yes I can," Red said. "Now do it!"

title: Flight to Fear, BesTellers
author: Tom Belina
description:
A FLIGHT YOU WILL NEVER FORGET
Red sat in a seat behind the pilot.  "Now…" he said slowly.  "Now I want you to crash this plane into the sea…"
"Are you crazy? You can't ask me to crash my plane into the sea," Captain Willliams said.
"Yes I can," Red said. "Now do it!"

title: Flood and Famine
author: Sharon Fear
description: Flood and Famine are a pair of prank-loving elephants. They are always causing trouble in the palace—splashing visitors and stealing food. Tired of their tricks, the raja calls in a trainer to teach them to behave. Flood and Famine have met their match. Soon, the pranks have stopped and the palace is calm and quiet—so why isn’t anyone happy?

title: Flutter The Story of Four Sisters and an Incredible Journey
author: Erin Moulton
description: Big things are about to happen at Maple's house. Mama's going to have a baby, which means now there will be four Rittle sisters instead of just three. However, baby Lily is born too early and can't come home from the hospital. Maple knows it's up to her to save her sister. So she and her sister Dawn head off to find the Wise Woman, who guards a pool with miraculous powers. Their journey takes them down a river, up a mountain, and into danger. As Maple and Dawn face the challenges of their journey, they realize a thing or two about miracles, and about each other.

title: Flygirl
author: Sherri L. Smith
description: All Ida Mae Jones wants to do is fly. Her daddy was a pilot, and years after his death, she feels closest to him when she's in the air. As a young black woman in 1940s Louisiana, the sky is off limits to her.  Then the United States enters World War II, and the military creates the branch of Women Airforce Service Pilots. Ida has a chance to fulfill her dream, but only if she's willing to use her light skin to pass as white. However, she soon learns that denying her true self and family is a heavy burden.

title: Flygirl
author: Sherri L. Smith
description: All Ida Mae Jones wants to do is fly. Her daddy was a pilot, and years after his death, she feels closest to him when she's in the air. As a young black woman in 1940s Louisiana, the sky is off limits to her.  Then the United States enters World War II, and the military creates the branch of Women Airforce Service Pilots. Ida has a chance to fulfill her dream, but only if she's willing to use her light skin to pass as white. However, she soon learns that denying her true self and family is a heavy burden.

title: Follow the Whales, BesTellers
author: Prescott Hill
description: "At first, I didn’t see anything wrong in hunting whales.  We killed them for their oil and their meat.  It seemed that if we didn't do it, someone else would.  After a while though, I got sick of all the killing.  I started to feel close to the whales.  What right did we have to kill them?  Finally I had a change of heart.  I wanted to save them from being wiped out."

title: Follow Your Dream, Double Fastback
author: Nancy White
description:
"I got the part! I got the lead!" I'm going to star in the play!" Mimi said excitedly.
"That's nice," Jose said in a flat tone of voice.
"Is that all you can say? Don't you realize what this means to me?" Mimi asked.
"I know what it means to me," Jose said slowly.  "We'll have less time than ever together.  I'll never get to see you."

title: Fortune in Men's Eyes (An American Family Series)
author: S.D. Jones
description: Young Matthew Wilder left his home and headed west to search for a fortune in gold. But instead of riches, Matthew found a lot of trouble. First he met Zeke- a runaway slave wanted for murder. Then he found himself torn between the U.S Army and an Indian tribe- both fighting for land and a different way of life. Now Matthew must choose sides. Will he line up with the soldiers who represent his country, or the red men who represent a part of his heritage?

title: Foul Play (A SporTellers Book)
author: Dick O'Connor
description: Dave Stennis knew that there were some Middletown fans who didn't think he should be playing. They weren't pleased when he wasn't on top of things, and they let him know it. Stennis tried not to let that get to him, but it did. He talked to TREE Thompson about it." I can't see why they pick on me," Stennis said, "I'm just a basketball player like the rest of the guys." But he really wasn't. Not in one special way.

title: Frankenstein, Adapted Classic
author: Mary Shelley
description:
When Victor Frankenstein goes to college, he studies some unusual and dangerous lessons. He researches and discovers  a way to create a life. Without giving any thought to the consequences of using such an awesome power, he immediately attempts create a man. He puts together parts of other dead men and brings them to life. The result is a person’s mind trapped in a monster’s body, destined to loneliness and frustration due to his frightening appearance. Shelley's tale of horror raises questions related to knowledge, scientific progress, and responsibility that are worth asking in any age.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Frankenstein, Pacemaker Classic
author: Mary Shelley
description:
When Victor Frankenstein goes to college, he studies some unusual and dangerous lessons. He researches and discovers  a way to create a life. Without giving any thought to the consequences of using such an awesome power, he immediately attempts create a man. He puts together parts of other dead men and brings them to life. The result is a person’s mind trapped in a monster’s body, destined to loneliness and frustration due to his frightening appearance. Shelley's tale of horror raises questions related to knowledge, scientific progress, and responsibility that are worth asking in any age.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Free At Last: The Story of Martin Luther King, Jr.
author: Angela Bull
description: Before he was a public figure, King was a minister’s son growing up in a time of segregation and prejudice.  He was shaped by his community, his experiences, and the circumstances of the times.This biography combines the story of King’s life with background information and explanations that will help you fully understand how one child born on January 15th, 1929 in Atlanta, Georgia became one of our most powerful and inspirational civil rights leaders. He encouraged nonviolent protest to fulfill his dream of an America where people would be judged by the content of their character, not by the color of their skin.

title: Freedom's Children: Young Civil Rights Activists Tell Their Own Stories
author: Ellen Levine
description: Only fifty years ago, African Americans did not have the same rights as white Americans, and many people treated them like second-class citizens. If you want to know about the heroes who struggled for justice and courageously acted for change, then there’s no better way than to read the stories of people who were there. In this collection of brief autobiographical accounts, thirty men and women who were young during America’s civil rights movement describe what they saw and how they felt.

title: Freshman Year & Other Unnatural Disasters
author: Meredith Zeitlin
description:
Kelsey Finkelstein is 14 years old and living in New York City. You'd think her life would be like a glamorous TV show. Yet she doesn't have a checking account or a credit card, she's never been to a club, and the only couture in her closet is a Halloween costume her mom made from an old laundry bag.

That's Kelsey Finkelstein. She's 14 and frustrated. Every time Kelsey tries to live up to her awesome potential, her plans are foiled. Kelsey wants to rebrand herself for high school and make the kind of mark she knows is her destiny. Of course, just because Kelsey has plans for greatness, doesn't mean the rest of the world is in on them.

Kelsey's hilarious commentary and sarcastic  narration will have readers laughing out loud...while being thankful they're not in her shoes.

title: From Moneybags to Mu Lan
author: Caught Reading
description: Mu Lan is rich. She is getting D's in school. Inez, Mu Lan's friend, knows someone who can help her. Her friend, Dan, gets all A's in school and needs money. Can Dan help Mu Lan? Will getting them together make more problems for everyone?

title: From Top to Bottom: Carving a Totem Pole
author: Diane Hoyt-Goldsmith
description: George wants to help his father carve a totem pole. His father makes it look easy, but George can’t do anything right. From the day they cut the log to the day they raise the pole, George makes mistakes on every step in the process.  So why is George’s father proud of him? In a tradition that values trying as well as talent, it turns out that making mistakes is part of the process.

title: Front Page Fight
author: Caught Reading
description: Ana moves to a new school. At her old school, she was the school paper's number one writer. At her new school, Jared is the number one writer. Ana and Jared both want to be the number one writer. How far will they go to get front page stories?

title: Fun House, Double Fastback
author: Ken Girard
description: Snegoff's Amusement Park is filled with attractions for both young and old.  There are exciting rides and challenging games. There is also the fun house. It's not scary at all, unless you want to come out alive.

title: Game Day
author: Dan J. Marlowe
description: Tom Jordan has never played tight end before, but he knows he has to play it as if he's been doing it for years.  If not, his first day on a professional football team might also be his last.

title: Game Day, Fastback
author: Dan J. Marlowe
description: Tom Jordan has never played tight end before, but he knows he has to play it as if he's been doing it for years.  If not, his first day on a professional football team might also be his last.

title: Glory Girl, Double Fastback
author: Janet Lorimer
description: Holly Kramer is excited about the big fencing tournament.  Not only does she help organize it, but she is also going to participate as a member of her team, the Blade Masters.  Everything looks great until Donna Hays joins the club.  Donna is bright, beautiful, and talented, but she is also something else. Donna is dangerous.

title: Good-Bye and Hello, Double Fastback
author: Jennie Abbott
description:
"Well, at least you should know how I feel," Bill said, taking Mady's face in his hands.  He bent down toward her and kissed her softly on each eyelid and then on her lips.
Breaking away, Mady whispered, "This makes things very difficult."
 "I want to make it as difficult as possible for you to leave," Bill replied softly.

title: Great American Short Stories I: Bret Harte
author: Bret Harte
description:
BRET HARTE
(1836-1902)

THE OUTCASTS OF POKER FLAT
Who can tell what a gambler will do when the chips are down? The good people of Poker Flat may have been wrong about John Oakhurst.

AN INGENUE OF THE SIERRAS
Can Yuba Bill outwit the gang of bandits? Or will the pretty young stagecoach passenger outwit him? 

HOW SANTA CLAUS CAME TO SIMPSON’S BAR
Christmas may seem like just another day when times are hard.  But how can anyone predict what Santa Claus might have in mind?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Charles W. Chestnut
author: Charles W. Chestnut
description:
CHARLES W. CHESNUTT
(1858-1932)

THE WIFE OF HIS YOUTH
Mr. Ryder has worked hard to build a new life.  Now something has come up.  How much claim does the past have on the present?

A MATTER OF PRINCIPLE
Cicero Clayton wants only the best for his daughter.  But is it possible to fight with prejudice?

THE SHERIFF’S CHILDREN
Sheriff Campbell faces a present challenge and a past regret.  Is it ever too late to right an old wrong?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Edgar Allan Poe
author: Edgar Allan Poe
description:
EDGAR ALLAN POE
(1809-1849)

THE CASK OF AMONTILLADO
Montresor is a clever man with revenge on his mind.  Will his flattery lure Fortunato into a deadly trap? 

THE MASQUE OF THE RED DEATH
Is it possible to outrun death?  Prince Prospero is betting his life that his plan will work.

THE TELL-TALE HEART
A criminal can sometimes outwit the police.  But can he outwit his own conscience?

THE BLACK CAT
What could make a good man do bad things?  A tormented man is haunted by a ghost of his own making.

title: Great American Short Stories I: Kate Chopin
author: Kate Chopin
description:
KATE CHOPIN
(1851-1904)

THE STORY OF AN HOUR
Mrs. Mallard’s husband is killed in an accident.  Her reaction to his death may surprise you. 

THE RECOVERY
A blind woman recovers her eyesight.  But does she want to see everything so clearly? 

THE LOCKET
Ned Pillar is going off to war.  Will Octavie’s locket keep him safe?

A PAIR OF SILK STOCKINGS
Mrs. Sommers goes off on a shopping spree.  What on earth has come over her?

THE KISS
Nathalie wants it both ways.  How can she choose between love and money?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Mark Twain
author: Mark Twain
description:
MARK TWAIN
(1835-1910)

THE CELEBRATED JUMPING FROG OF CALAVERAS COUNTY
How far would Jim Smiley go to win a bet? Just as far has to go.

THE CALIFORNIA’S TALE
A lonely prospector misses his wife. As usual, he's planning a welcome-home party. 

THE PROFESSOR’S YARN
John Backus talk and acts like a boring fool.  But is he really the man he seems to be?

THE MILLION-POUND BANK-NOTE
Talk about lucky! An argument between two brothers makes a poor stranger rich.

A FABLE
How much are you likely to see if you stand in your own way?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Nathaniel Hawthorne
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description:
NATHANIEL HAWTHORNE
(1804-1864)

THE BIRTHPLACE
A brilliant doctor is torn between his love of science and his love for his wife.  Is perfection worth any sacrifice?

THE THREEFOLD DESTINY
Ralph Cranfield has traveled the world in search of his destiny.  Now he’s come home, disappointed.  Is it time for Ralph to give up on his dreams?

AN OLD WOMEN’S TALE
David and Esther travel backward in time.  What do they see in the village of their grandparents?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Sarah Orne Jewett
author: Sarah Orne Jewett
description:
SARAH ORNE JEWETT
(1849-1909)

A WHITE HERON
Only Sylvy has the information the stranger needs.  Will she have the courage to guard her secret?

THE HILTON’S HOLIDAY
What could be so exciting about a visit to a country town? To the Hilton girls, it’s a door to the outside world.

FAME’S LITTLE DAY
New York is full of visitors from small towns.  What’s so special about the Pinkhams of Vermont?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Sherwood Anderson
author: Sherwood Anderson
description:
SHERWOOD ANDERSON
(1876-1941)

SOPHISTICATION
Two young friends reach the same turning point.  How can they help each other?

THE UNTOLD LIE
Ray Pearson has a moment of truth.  Can he warn his young friend in time?

PAPER PILLS
What does a small town doctor think about as he makes his daily rounds?

AN AWAKENING
Young George Willard has a lesson to learn.  Can a bad experience be a good teacher?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Washington Irving
author: Washington Irving
description:
WASHINGTON IRVING
(1783-1859)

RIP VAN WINKLE
How could a man’s beard grow so long in just one night?  And what has become of his faithful dog?

THE DEVIL AND TOM WINKLER
A greedy man makes a bargain with the devil.  What happens when his debt comes due? 

THE SPECTER BRIDEGROOM
A daughter of royalty agrees to marry a man she’s never met.  But why would anyone want to marry a ghost?

title: Great American Short Stories I: Willa Cather
author: Willa Cather
description:
WILLA CATHER
(1873-1947)

PAUL’S CASE
An artistic schoolboy is caught between two worlds.  How can there be such a gap between dreams and reality?

THE SCULPTOR’S FUNERAL
The hometown folks were always jealous of that sculptor’s fame.  Will they praise him now that he’s dead?

THE WAY OF THE WORLD
Speckle is riding high.  Not many boys have a town named after them.  But why can’t good times last forever?

title: Great American Short Stories II: Alice Dunbar-Nelson
author: Alice Dunbar-Nelson
description:
ALICE DUNAR-NELSON
(1875-1935)

HOPE DEFERRED
Prejudice is a thief.  Will it rob the young man of his faith in the future?

TITEE
Titee is different from the other children.  Is he a problem child?  A hero? Or both?

THE STONES OF THE VILLAGE
The judge is an honored man¬—as long as his past stays hidden

title: Great American Short Stories II: Edith Wharton
author: Edith Wharton
description:
EDITH WHARTON
(1860-1937)

THE POMERGRANTE SEED
Charlotte Ashby has it all.  She loves her elegant life and her adoring husband.  But just lately something has come between them.  Why won’t he tell the truth about the mysterious letters?

THE MOVING FINGER
Does art imitate life of does life imitate art? A portrait of a beautiful woman comes between two old friends.  Which man has the right to decide how Mrs. Granby will be remembered?

title: Great American Short Stories II: Edna Ferber
author: Edna Ferber
description:
EDNA FERBER 
(1887-1968)

REPRESENTING T. A. BUCK
A traveling saleswoman has doubts about her career—until she hits on a hot prospect. 

THE THREE OF THEM
Wartime is hard to bear for every soldier’s mother—even if she’s a famous stage star.

SHORE LEAVE
A young sailor gets his first weekend off.  Will the big city be all that he expected?

title: Great American Short Stories II: Frank R. Stockton
author: Frank R. Stockton
description:
FRANK R. STOCKTON
(1834-1902)

THE LADY OR THE TIGER?
Which is the stronger motive¬—love or jealously?  The princess would do anything to marry the man she loves.  Too bad that’s not one of her choices. 

THE GRIFFIN AND THE MINOR CANON
The creature is horrible.  He has the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle!  How can the town get rid of him? 

THE WIDOW’S CRUISE
Some liars stretch the truth to the breaking point.  This time the old sailor may have pushed his listeners too far. 

A PIECE OF RED CALICO
A helpful husband is sent on an errand.  How could a simple shopping trip into such a nightmare?

title: Great American Short Stories II: Hamlin Garland
author: Hamlin Garland
description:
HAMLIN GARLAND
(1860-1940)

UNDER THE LION’S PAW
An unlucky farmer is looking for another chance.  Is that too much to ask from the biggest landowner in the country?

THE RETURN OF A PRIVATE
What would it be like to come home after years away at war?  Is the man who returns the same as the man who left?

MRS. RIPLEY’S TRIP
What’s come over Mrs. Ripley?  Her family is shocked by her plan.  Will she have the nerve to go ahead with it anyway?

title: Great American Short Stories II: Irvin S. Cobb
author: Irvin S. Cobb
description:
IRVIN S. COBB
(1876-1944)

FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS REWARD
Jim Faxon is a peaceful fellow.  But even the best of men can reach a breaking point.

WORDS AND MUSIC
The man he killed was very popular.  How can Breck Tandy ever get a fair trail?

A DOGGED UNDERDOG
Is Singin’ Sandy Rigs a brave man or a fool?  Folks are still arguing about his story.

title: Great American Short Stories II: Mary Wilkins Freeman
author: Mary Wilkins Freeman
description:
MARY WILKINS FREEMAN
(1852-1930)

THE REVOLT OF MOTHER
Father promised her a new house 40 years ago.  Mother thinks she’s waited long enough.

LOUISA
Independence means everything to Louisa.  Can she save her family and her self-respect?

MISTAKEN CHARITY
Is too much help worse than no help at all? Two stubborn old sisters certainly think so.

title: Great American Short Stories II: Ring Lardner
author: Ring Lardner
description:
RING LARDNER
(1885-1933)

A BUSHER’S LETTER HOME
A young pitcher yearns to play big league baseball.  At last he gets his chance!

THE BUSHER COMES BACK
Jack has trouble keeping his mind on the game.  Or is “girl trouble” the real problem?

title: Great American Short Stories II: Stephen Crane
author: Stephen Crane
description:
STEPHEN CRANE
(1871-1900)

THE OPEN BOAT
The steamer Commodore has sunk.  Four men are stranded at sea.  Their little boat is leaking badly.  What are their thoughts and feelings as they try to reach land? 

THE BRIDE COMES TO YELLLOW SKY
A gunslinger is spoiling for a showdown.  Always before, the town marshal has given him a fight.  Why should today be any different.

title: Great American Short Stories II: Theodore Dreiser
author: Theodore Dreiser
description:
THEODORE DREISER
(1871-1945)
 
THE LOST PHOEBE 
Do some loves last a lifetime?  Old Henry’s love lasted a good deal longer. 

THE CRUISE OF THE IDLEWILD
The bit of fantasy is good for the soul.  Why did little Ike get tired of pretending?

MCEWEN AND THE SHINING SLAVE MAKERS
How could a quick nap turn into a life-and-death adventure?  McEwen is still not sure.

title: Great American Short Stories II: Thomas Bailey Aldrich
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich
description:
THOMAS BAILEY ALDRICH
(1836-1907)

MARJORIE DAW 
Has Jack found the girl of his dreams?  Marjorie Daw seems too good to be true.

A STRUGGLE FOR LIFE
Philip prays that someone will find him soon.  But who would think to look in a cemetery?

MADEMOISELLE OLYMPE ZABRISKI
A trapeze artist is all grace and beauty.  Or so it seems to young Van Twiller.

title: Great American Short Stories II: Wilbur Daniel Steele
author: Wilbur Daniel Steele
description:
WILBUR DANIEL STEELE
(1886-1970)

FOR THEY KNOW NOT WHAT THEY DO
The Kain family has a deep dark secret.  Can Young Christopher escape the curse?

OUT OF EXILE
Two brothers want to marry the same woman.  How will she choose between them?

THE YELLOW CAT
No one knows why the crew deserted their ship.  If only the yellow ship could talk!

title: Great British and Irish Short Stories: Arthur Conan Doyle
author: ARTHUR CONAN DOYLE
description:
ARTHUR CONAN DOYLE 
(1859-1930)

THE RED-HEADED LEAGUE 
At first, Holmes thinks the Red-Headed League is quite amusing.  But he finds nothing to laugh at when the truth begins to unfold. 

THE ADVENTURES OF THE SPECKLED BAND
A young woman dies under mysterious circumstances.  Is her evil stepfather to blame?  Or is something even stranger lurking in the old manor house?

title: Great British and Irish Short Stories: E. M. Forster
author: E. M. Forster
description:
E.M. FORSTER
(1879-1970)

THE STORY OF A PANIC
A bored young English boy takes a holiday in Italy.  What happens to him in the mountains changes his whole life.

THE OTHER SIDE OF THE HEDGE
What might heaven be like?  A weary young man decides to find out for himself.  What he sees on “the other side” is far different from what he expected.

title: Great British and Irish Short Stories: Katherine Mansfield
author: Katherine Mansfield
description:
KATHERINE MANSFIELD
(1888-1923)
 
A CUP OF TEA 
A bored rich woman likes to “discover” new people.  Should she take the street girl home for tea? 

THE WOMAN AT THE STORE 
Can too much loneliness drive a person mad?  Some travelers have their doubts about the woman at the store. 

A DILL PICKLE 
A woman and her former lover meet again by chance.  Will she regret that she ever left him? 

THE CANARY
An old woman loses her dearest friend.  Can her memories help keep him alive?

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A poor young orphan named Pip is about to embark on a brand new life. After a terrifying encounter with an escaped convict in a graveyard on the wild Kent marshes, Pip receives a summons to meet the bitter, decaying Miss Havisham and her beautiful, cold-hearted ward Estella. Then, with the sudden generosity of a mysterious benefactor, Pip eagerly abandons his humble origins to begin a new life as a gentleman. Charles Dickens's haunting novel depicts Pip's education and development through adversity, as he discovers the true nature of his great expectations.

title: Great Expectations, Pacemaker Classic
author: Charles Dickens
description:
A poor young orphan named Pip is about to embark on a brand new life. After a terrifying encounter with an escaped convict in a graveyard on the wild Kent marshes, Pip receives a summons to meet the bitter, decaying Miss Havisham and her beautiful, cold-hearted ward Estella. Then, with the sudden generosity of a mysterious benefactor, Pip eagerly abandons his humble origins to begin a new life as a gentleman. Charles Dickens's haunting novel depicts Pip's education and development through adversity, as he discovers the true nature of his great expectations.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Alphonse Daudet
author: Alphonse Daudet
description:
ALPHONSE DAUDET 
(1840-1897)

THE LAST LESSON
Until today, the boy would rather do anything than study.  What happens o make him change his mind?

THE OLD FOLKS
A man visits his friend’s grandparents as a special favor.  What begins as s duty ends as a delight.

THE SIEGE OF BERLIN
What harm can it do to lie to the old man? The doctor is afraid that the truth would kill him.

THE CHILD SPY
A young French boy acts before he thinks.  How can selling a few newspapers have such a terrible consequences?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Alphonse Daudet
author: Alphonse Daudet
description:

(1840-1897)

THE SIEGE OF BERLIN
What harm can it do to lie to the old man? The doctor is afraid that the truth would kill him.

THE CHILD SPY
A young French boy acts before he thinks.  How can selling a few newspapers have such a terrible consequences?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Anton Chekhov
author: Anton Chekhov
description:
ANTON CHEKHOV
(1860-1904)

THE BET
Two men at a party make a high-stakes bet.  But should even a poor man lay his freedom on the line?

GOOSEBERRIES
Is success worth any sacrifice?  Nikolay Ivanych thinks so.  His brother has quite a different opinion.  

THE LITTLE APPLES
A powerful landowner enjoys bullying the peasants.  Does one evil deed set the stage for another?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Fydor Dostoevsky
author: Fydor Dostoevsky
description:
FYODOR DOSTOEVSKY 
(1821-1881)

THE HONEST THEIF
Emelian seems to be hopeless—in spite of his friend’s help.  But do a person’s problems tell the whole story?

THE CHRISTMAS TREE AND A WEDDING
Years have gone by since Julian Mastakovic first made his plan.  But if greed is his vice, patience is his virtue. 

THE PEASANT MAREY
Can a moment’s kindness have a lifelong effect? A prisoner’s days are comforted by childhood memory.

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Fydor Dostoevsky
author: Fydor Dostoevsky
description:
FYODOR DOSTOEVSKY 
(1821-1881)

THE HONEST THEIF
Emelian seems to be hopeless—in spite of his friend’s help.  But do a person’s problems tell the whole story?

THE CHRISTMAS TREE AND A WEDDING
Years have gone by since Julian Mastakovic first made his plan.  But if greed is his vice, patience is his virtue. 

THE PEASANT MAREY
Can a moment’s kindness have a lifelong effect? A prisoner’s days are comforted by childhood memory.

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Guy de Maupassant
author: Guy de Maupassant
description:
GUY DE MAUPASSANT 
(1850-1893)

THE NECKLACE
A borrowed necklace mysteriously disappears.  How can Matilda ever afford to replace it?

THE UMBRELLA
Can a true penny-pincher ever be reformed? Madame Oreille is a tough case. 

THE SPECTER
A dead wife appears as her grieving husband drops out of sight.  What’s going on here?

THE OLD MAN
Daron is very stubborn old man.  But is it possible to outwit death?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Honore' de Balzac
author: Honore' de Balzac
description:
HONORE DE BALZAC
(1799-1850)

THE MYSTERIOUS MANSION
A grand old house has been left to rot.  Why are people afraid to live there?

THE THING AT GHENT
What could make an old woman leap up from her deathbed? Is she protecting one last secret?

A PASSION IN THE DESERT
The escaped soldier has just one companion in the desert.  The only problem is that he can’t trust her.

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Leo Tolstoy
author: Leo Tolstoy
description:
LEO TOLSTOY 
(1828-1910)

HOW MUCH LAND DOES A MAN NEED?
A poor peasant yearns to move up in the world.  Finally he buys a little land—and then a little more.

THE THREE HERMITS
A bishop learns a lesson that he’ll never forget.  His unlikely teachers are some very strange fellows.

THE LONG EXILE
An innocent man is imprisoned for murder.  Does everybody deal with injustice in the same way?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Leopoldo Alas
author: Leopoldo Alas
description:
LEOPOLDO ALAS
(1852-1901)

DONA BERTA
A young woman sacrifices happiness for the sake of family honor.  But now her brothers are dead.  Is it too late for Dona Berta to salvage her own pride?

ADIOS, CORDERA!
All Rosa and Pinin have is the meadow and their cow.  Will their father’s bad luck rob them of the only world they have ever known?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Mori Ogwai
author: Mori Ogwai
description:
MORI OGWAI
(1862-1922)

TAKASE BUNE
The prisoner tells a guard the truth about his crime.  His story doesn’t sound a bit like the police report.

HANAKO
The great sculptor Rodin is looking for a model.  What seems so special about the Japanese dancer? 

THE PIER
A Japanese noble leaves on an ocean voyage.  What does the separation mean to his devoted wife?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Rabindranath Tagore
author: Rabindranath Tagore
description:
RABINDRANATH TAGORE
(1861-1941)

THE CASTAWAY
A homeless boy moves in with a wealthy family.  Is he as innocent as he looks?

THE SKELETON
A sleeping man is awakened by a talkative ghost.  It seems that she’s looking for something.

MY FAIR NEIGHBOR
A poet encourages his friend’s romance.  What makes him regret his good deed?

THE AUSPICIOUS VISION
A wealthy widower falls in love at first sight.  Is it wise to marry in haste?

title: Great Short Stories from Around the World: Selma Lagerlof
author: Selma Lagerlof
description:
SELMA LAGERLOF 
(1858-1940)

THE OUTLAWS
Two fugitives hide out in the woods.  Their personalities are as different as their crimes.  Can they learn to get along—or will their differences destroy them?

KEVEN HULLER
A clever inventor receives a magical gift.  Unfortunately, the gift has a downside. Can he figure out how to stop the destruction?

title: Growing up with Music: The Amazing Marsalis Family
author: Murphy, Catherine
description: Imagine growing up in a big family where almost everybody plays music. Your dad plays the piano and your brother plays the trumpet. Three of your other brothers play instruments, too- the saxophone, the trombone, and the drums. Your mom has a beautiful voice and used to sing with a jazz band. With a family like that, your house could swing with the sounds of music every night.

title: Gulliver's Travels, Adapted Classic
author: Swift, Jonathan
description:
Jonathan Swift invents fantastic creatures and imaginary lands for the travels of Lemuel Gulliver, a man who ends up in some very strange places. On one voyage, he is brought to an island country that floats through the air dropping “boulder bombs.” On another trip, Gulliver encounters the tiny Lilliputians, who want to use him as a weapon of mass destruction in their miniature world.  When he lands in a country ruled by intelligent, rational horses—he is kicked out for being inferior! When you are done traveling with Gulliver, will see the world in a new way!

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Gymnastics: The Trials, The Triumphs, The Truth
author: Daniel Gutman
description: How did Kerri Strug go from Olympic hopeful to Olympic champion? How does Dominique Moceanu spend a typical day? This thorough, fun-to-read book answers those questions and many more. You’ll learn the ins and outs of the equipment and events, find out how scoring is done, read about the history of the sport, and lots more! Dan Gutman’s insider look at gymnastics is sure to enthrall aspiring gymnasts and devoted fans alike. A glossary, a chronology, and an entertaining chapter of gymnastics trivia round out this overview of a popular sport.

title: Gypsy
author: Al Nussbaum
description:
"WHEN YOU RACE, YOU RACE TO WIN.

Suddenly, the first machine slid wide on a turn.  The rider crashed into Pinky when he tried to slip by.  The two bikes and their riders ended up in a pile, blocking the track.
Alan and the rider ahead of him raced at the downed bikers.  Neither slowed a bit."

title: Gypsy, BesTellers
author: Al Nussbaum
description:
WHEN YOU RACE, YOU RACE TO WIN

Suddenly, the first machine slid wide on a turn. The rider crashed into Pinky when he tried to slip by. The two bikes and their riders ended up in a pile, blocking the track. Alan and the rider ahead of him raced at the downed bikers. Neither slowed a bit.

title: Halloween Hunt, Double Fastback
author: Richard Laymon
description: It starts as a game. Two teams go out on Halloween night trying to collect weird things.  This means visiting some odd places, but the prize money is terrific.  Then Linda and her friends reach the attic of the old Winslow house. The horror they find waiting there isn't worth all the money in the world.

title: Hamlet, Adapted Classic
author: William Shakespeare
description:
This play is an adventure, a ghost story, a love story, and finally, a tragedy. When the ghost of his father visits Hamlet, the prince of Denmark, he  learns that his father was murdered by his own brother, Hamlet's uncle, who then married Hamlet's mother. Young Prince Hamlet swears revenge. However, when he does not immediately kill his uncle, the ghost visits again to urge Hamlet to action. Why does Hamlet delay? Is it doubt, confusion, fear, procrastination, or all of the above?  This gripping drama full of treachery, betrayal, rage, and madness reveals the dark consquences when  love, grief, power, and passion are taken too far. 

This is an adapted drama. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original play.

title: Heart of Darkness and The Congo Diary
author: Joseph Conrad
description: Charles Marlowe, a riverboat captain working for a Belgian trading company, tells the story of his journey in search of the mysterious Kurtz, a company man who has disappeared on the continent of Africa. Marlowe finds Kurtz in the jungle, in a position of great power and influence over the local people. Soon, Marlowe discovers that Kurtz has also gone mad. Surrounded by horror and cut off from society, Marlowe begins to question his own beliefs and values as well as the values of his society. Conrad's novel explores the evil people can do when they abandon civilized society…and when they work from within it.

title: Helen Keller: The Story of My Life, Adapted Classic
author: Helen Keller
description:
Unable to see, to hear, or to speak, Helen Keller was 22 when she took time out of her studies at Radcliffe to share in this autobiography how, with help from Anne Sullivan and others, she unlocked her world and found communication. Witness as her struggle changed from one of frustration to one of fulfillment the moment she made the connection between the cool liquid running over her hands and the letters “w-a-t-e-r” that Anne fingerspells. This is an inspirational journey of triumph that many did not believe was possible.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Helping Hands: Wildlife Rehabilitation at Work
author: Marsh, J.P.
description: Predators stalk them. Highways with speeding vehicles cut through their territory. Power lines crisscross their flyways. Bad weather threatens their food supply. Life for wild animals can be dangerous, whether from contact with humans or other hazards.

title: Hennesy's Test, Fastback
author: Dave Smeds
description:
"This is it?"
"This is the test,"" Master Sprague replied.  His face was creased with wrinkles.  "All you have to do is climb the stairs."
"Climb the stairs?"
"Yes.  But you'll have to climb them the way the a sorcerer would." The two masters chuckled.  Hennesy thought they were making fun of him.

title: High Escape (A SporTellers Book)
author: Eve Cowen
description: The trouble happened right away. Irina came speeding toward the first gate. It was the same one that had given Dory trouble in the second race. As Irina went into it she fell, the the pole with her. She turned over and over while her skis flew high into the air. For a while, it seemed that she might roll and slide all the way down the hill. People were screaming. Dory felt her heart pounding. Then she started running toward Irina.

title: History Dudes Ancient Egyptians
author: DK Publishing
description:
Take a romp into the past and meet the dudes who made history happen.

Thousands of years ago, a mighty civilisation flourished on the banks of the River Nile. Its people built incredible pyramids and temples, worshipped their kings and queens as gods, and used tortoise brains as a cure for eyesight problems.

Come face-to-face with a wig maker who reveals the bald truth about hairstyles, visit a gang of tomb raiders who’ll show how they stole incredible treasures and join troublemaking Pharaoh Akhenaten who explains why he tried to change everyone’s religion

title: Hitting the Ice
author: Quincy Howe
description: It starts out as pleasant afternoon.  Vesey and his friends are having fun at the ice-skating rink. But then, Vesey sees the Drake brothers on the ice.  This can only mean one thing—trouble!

title: Hong Kong Heat, BesTellers
author: Robert Colby
description:
Under the bright morning sun, Dennis watched for trouble.  From time to time he turned around to see if he was being followed.
"Watch for a knife,"" Dennis told himself.  "Be sure you don't find it in your back."

title: How Coyote Gave Fire to People
author: Maggie Bridger
description: It’s a cold, dark, dangerous winter at the beginning of time. With no fur, the human race is in danger of freezing to death. Their animal friends know the humans need fire.  However, when the world was new, fire belonged to the fireflies and they don’t want to share. They have no compassion and they never let their guard down. Someone needs to trick the fireflies—and Coyote is a trickster! See how Coyote fools the fireflies to help his human friends in this ancient myth about how humans learned to make fire.

title: I Died Here, BesTellers
author: George Shea
description:
A BAD DREAM COMES TRUE
Larry had known the little Greek town of Drakola in his dream.  It was the place where he had lived in another life.  It was the place where he had died.  He was killed there because of something he knew.  What was it?  Why did he keep telling himself.. I died here?

title: If You Come Softly
author: Jacqueline Woodson
description: Jeremiah knows it won't be easy fitting in at a fancy Manhattan prep school. He expects problems, but he certainly doesn't expect to fall in love. Then, he meets Ellie. She's white and Jewish. He's black, and he's not Jewish. That's not a problem for Jeremiah and Ellie, but it looks like it might be a big problem for everyone else, a problem that could get out of hand.

title: In the Zone, Fastback
author: Jon Nikischer
description: Did it work only with animals, or could he change places with a person?  Would it be possible to go back into the past and forward into the future?  What were the limits?  Were there any limits?

title: In Winter's Hand (Amazing Adventures Series)
author: Janice Greene
description: It had been an unlucky year for Ben and Sonny. They'd spent more than 12 months in the Alaskan Klondike searching for gold- and had come up empty. Now, their guide Quint is urging them to give up and head back to Nome before the storms of the winter of 1898 make the trail impossible. As they begin the trip back, their luck suddenly changes when Sonny strikes it rich. With the riches, though, comes a change in Sonny. "Gold fever" and greed threaten his friendship with Ben- and the very survival of all threee men.

title: Inaugural Presidential Address, Official Transcript by Barack Obama
author: Obama, Barack
description:
As all new presidents do upon being sworn in, or inaugurated, Barack Obama made a speech.  His inaugural address reflects some similarities with the speech of another president trying to communicate hope in a time of crisis... Abraham Lincoln. Obama called "for a new age" in much the same way that Lincoln spoke of "a new birth" in his speech at Gettysburg. Obama further echoed Lincoln by saying "all are equal, all are free" and that "men and women and children of every race and every faith can join in celebration."

Although there are similarities between the two speeches, each speech is specific to its own time, place, and situation. In addition, quotations from speeches should not be read out of context. So read President Obama’s complete inauguration speech to fully appreciate his unique message as he began his historic administration as the first African American President of the United States.

title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
author: Jacobs, Harriet (aka Linda Brent)
description: In this autobiographical account, Harriet Jacobs, calling herself Linda Brent, describes her suffering as a young slave girl growing up in the 1800s. Her descriptions of constant sexual abuse and the struggles of motherhood illustrate the unique horrors endured by enslaved women.  Harriet is determined to save her children from a similar fate. To protect them, she hides in a tiny attic space for seven long years. Harriet's story is horrifyingly, shockingly true. However, her experiences and actions are also a testament to the power of the human spirit and the strength of a mother's love for her children.

title: Isaac Newton (Giants of Science)
author: Kathleen Krull
description: Isaac Newton was secretive, mean-spirited, withdrawn, obsessive, and, of course, brilliant. His imagination was so powerful that he was able to determine a scientific explanation of gravity by just "thinking on it."  Yet Newton was also small-minded. If other scientists  questioned his work, he resented them. Sometimes, he tried to ruin their careers. This books presents a compelling portrait of Newton as a genius full of contradictions. Author Kathleen Krull tells the story of how a man from seventeenth-century England lived and worked through plagues, the Great Fire of London, and two revolutions to become one of the most influential scientists in history.

title: It’s a Mammal!
author: Sharon Stewart
description: What do you, dogs, bats, and whales have in common? You are all mammals! Read It’s a Mammal! to find out how mammals live and what makes them special.

title: It's Not About the Bike: My Journey Back to Life
author: Armstrong, Lance
description:
Lance Armstrong is a record-breaking cyclist, a seven-time winner of the Tour de France, a cancer survivor, a husband, a father, and a son. His memoir focuses on his journey through triumph, pain, recovery, and renewal. 
When a champion is told that a disease has left him with only a twenty percent chance of survival, he does not give up; he fights it with everything he has. At least that’s what Lance Armstrong did.  He underwent grueling and aggressive treatments and surgery. He pushed himself physically to regain his strength and competitive edge.  Finally, on long bike rides through the mountains of North Carolina, he reawakened his passion for his sport and rededicated himself to appreciating the gift of life.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Bronte, Charlotte
description:
In this novel, Jane Eyre tells her own story of growing up in early nineteenth-century England. She begins when she’s ten, an orphan living with her cruel aunt and bullying cousins. Then, at boarding school, Jane’s teachers mistreat her, and a wave of sickness takes her only friend’s life. Eight years later, after leaving school, Jane finds a job as a nanny. She secretly falls in love with her employer, and when he suddenly proposes, she’s shocked and overjoyed. Jane thinks her troubles are finally over, but then she learns her fiancé’s terrible secret.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Jane Eyre, Adapted Classic
author: Bronte, Charlotte
description:

title: Janie, Fastback
author: Dan J. Marlowe
description: You take my breath away, Janie.  When you walk in the room, you make everyone happy, but something is bothering you.  What's your trouble, Janie?

title: Jim Thorpe, Original All-American
author: Joseph Bruchac
description: Jim Thorpe was one of the greatest athletes who ever lived. He played professional football and Major League baseball, and won Olympic gold medals in track and field. However, his life wasn’t easy. Born on a reservation, he endured family tragedy and was sent to various Native American boarding schools. Jim ran away from school many times, until he found his calling under the now-legendary coach Pop Warner. This is a book for history buffs as well as sports fans. It is an illuminating and lively read about a truly great American by award-winning author Joseph Bruchac.

title: John F. Kennedy's Remarks in San Antonio
Journey Between Worlds
author: Sylvia Engdahl
description:
Melinda Ashley never wanted to go to Mars. She had her life all planned out: Marry Ross, become a teacher, and inherit the beloved family home. However, when her estranged father convinces her to take a trip with him to a remote colony on Mars, she finds herself tempted to leave her comfortable existence on Earth behind. Mars proves to be quite different than she had imagined, and when she meets Alex Preston, a second generation Martian colonist, she finds herself on a surprising new path.
This timeless novel of a young woman’s journey between two worlds has stirred readers’ imaginations for generations.

title: Journey to the Sea (Amazing Adventures Series)
author: S.D. Jones
description: As Tom Doyle looked out at the Pacific Ocean, he thought of all he'd been through on his journey west. He'd left St. Louis with Lewis and Clark in May 1804. For 18 months, their group had braved wild rivers, raging snowstorms, and hostile Indians to find a western route to the sea. Tom learned a lot about the people and the land on his trip. He learned some things about himself, too. He learned how to remove the hatred he'd carried in his heart for a long time- and to let go of the memory of his late father once for all.

title: Julius Caesar, Adapted Classic
author: William Shakespeare
description:
More than two thousand years ago, Rome had taken control of the world, and Julius Caesar had taken control of Rome. Although Rome was a republic with a senate to represent the people and make laws, some Roman senators feared that Caesar was gaining too much power and popularity. They were afraid that he would get rid of the senate altogether and become a dictator. As a result, eight senators make and carry out a plan to kill Julius Caesar.  

Shakespeare’s historical drama puts a personal face on the public and political actions. Through the characters of Brutus, Cassius, Marc Antony, Calpurnia, and others, Shakespeare explores the human foibles, the internal conflicts, the petty resentments, the character flaws, and the fears that influence the outcome historical events. 

This is an adapted drama. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original play.

author: William Shakespeare

title: Jungle Jenny, BesTellers
author: Eve Cowen
description:
TRAPPED IN THE JUNGLE

She left Boston and flew to Brazil.  
Cliff was right.  Brazil was a strange country.  Strange and beautiful, he has told her.  And he wanted her there. How could she know that soon she would become Jungle Jenny?
This is a story you will live second by second!

title: Just In Case, Fastback
author: Jon Nikischer
description: Instead of clearing up my questions, he has given me something else to wonder about: Why had he seemed to separate himself from others?  It was as though he didn't think he was human like the rest of us.  That's really crazy, isn't it?

title: Kidnapped
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
description:
As this novel begins, young David Balfour’s parents have just died. After he makes his way to his rich uncle’s estate, David discovers that the estate actually belongs to him. Unfortunately, David’s uncle realizes that David knows the truth and plans an evil solution to the problem. After failing to cause David to have an “accident,” his uncle takes him to visit a ship in a nearby harbor. Then, just as David notices that his uncle is making his way back to shore in a rowboat, David is knocked unconscious.

This is how David Balfour’s adventures begin. With a plot full of shipwrecks, schemes, revolutions, assassinations, battles, and narrow escapes, can David survive being kidnapped?

title: Kids On Strike!
author: Susan Campbell Bartoletti
description: Please choose another book from the Library. You will be reading this book in class.

title: Kiss and Make Up, Double Fastback
author: T. P. Turner
description:
As soon as she entered the office, Abbie noticed the beautiful vase of flowers sitting on her desk.  Of course, she knew who sent them.
"Thank you,"" Abbie said, beaming at Ben as he appeared from around her corner.  She sat down at her desk.  
"OK, we're at work now," said Ben. "So let's get down to business."  His voice sounded almost stern, but his eyes betrayed how happy he was to have Abbie working with him.

title: Leonardo da Vinci (Giants of Science)
author: Kathleen Krull
description: Most people think of Leonardo da Vinci as an artist. However, there was another side to him. For more than half his life, da Vinci investigated the natural world. In Leonardo's lifetime,  the study of "science" was based largely on ideas and supersitions passed down through the centuries.  Many "doctors" believed that pig manure was the best treatment for a nosebleed and that plagues were caused by the planets. Leonardo took a diffferent approach. He used observation and experimentation. He even performed secret (and illegal) autopsies to learn about the human body. His notebooks, filled with detailed and amazingly accurate diagrams, sketches, and notes, are evidence that a fifteenth-century scientific genius stood at the edge of our modern world.

title: Les Miserables, Adapted Classic
author: Hugo, Victor
description:
The story begins with Jean Valjean in prison where he is serving a sentence far out of proportion to the minor crime he committed in a desperate attempt to feed his family. Angry and bitter, he turns his back on the world, until a stranger’s act of overwhelming generosity and kindness reawakens Valjean’s humanity. He dedicates his life to doing good and caring for his adopted daughter, Cosette. However, when the secret of his criminal past threatens Cosette’s happiness and security, Valjean is prepared to make the ultimate sacrifice.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Lewis and Clark: A Journey of Discovery
author: Costello, Emily
description: In 1804, President Thomas Jefferson sent an expedition team, lead by Meriweather Lewis and William Clark, to explore lands that the United States had purchased. This land was called the Louisiana Purchase. Lewis and Clark traveled for over two years, meeting Native American tribes, discovering new plants, and encountering never before seen animals, such as bison and grizzly bears. One of their most important guides was a Native American woman named Sacagawea. Read this book to learn about the adventures that Lewis and Clark had as they explored the lands from Missouri to the Pacific Coast.

title: Life on the Color Line
author: Gregory Williams
description: Until Greogory Williams was 10 years old, he believed he was white. However, when his mother left in 1954, Williams's father moved the family to Indiana to live with relatives. There, Williams and his brothers discovered that their mother and father had kept a secret from them. Their father, although light-skinned, was African American. Join Williams as he describes his real-life struggles with racism from both sides and his attempt to succeed and find his true identity.

title: Life on the Mississippi
author: Twain, Mark
description: Author Mark Twain’s real name was Samuel Clemens. His "pen name" comes from his time as a riverboat pilot on the Mississippi River in the mid- to late-1800s, The call of "Mark, twain" indicated that the water was marked, or measured, to be twelve feet deep.  In this book, Twain combines memoir with travel writing. He offers entertaining anecdotes about the history, people, and atmosphere of the mighty Mississippi and recalls some of his own humorous adventures on the river.  He even explains the origin of his "pen name" when he describes an old Mississippi River pilot who would write paragraphs about the river and sign the name “Mark Twain” on them.

title: Little Big Top, BesTellers
author: Doris Hiller
description: Blowing the show: That's what circus people call it when you leave before the season is over.  Ben Vincent won't blow the show. He likes to finish everything he starts.  He wants to become an acrobat, to fly high in the Big Top with the Great Zellinis. However, someone is at work to change his plans, to finish him before he flies in the little big top.

title: Little Women, Adapted Classic
author: Louisa May Alcott
description:
Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy are four sister, in Massachusetts, in the 1860s. They go through all the things that young women go through and share with their sisters as they grow up: support, jealousy, dreams, romance, tragedy, love, ambition, marriage, motherhood. Of course, these sisters have to go through a lot of it during the Civil War. This novel paints a clear and colorful portrait of their homes, their habits, and their hearts.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

author: Louisa May Alcott

title: Live Bait, Fastback
author: Richard Laymon
description: Nora's ride ends with two flats.  Now she is stuck in the middle of nowhere.  Will she find help in the lighted cabin down the road…or will she find herself in a living nightmare?

title: Looking for Trouble
author: Quincy Howe
description: Hi-C hits the big city and he’s wired for action.  This is the place for living large with fancy cars, easy money, and lots of excitement.  But real life is not always like the movies.  Hi-C is about to learn the lesson of his life.

title: Lord Jim, Adapted Classic
author: Joseph Conrad
description:
Jim had gone to sea when he was very young. His charm and good looks helped him rise through the ranks. Although he had always dreamed of becoming a real hero, he had never had his courage or resolve tested. Then, one night serving as a mate on a passenger ship, Jim got his chance. The ship hit something and began to sink. However, when the other officers jumped ship, Jim did too, leaving all the passengers behind. Later, a trial found him guilty of abandoning ship. Jim was publicly stripped of his rank and humiliated. Will Jim ever be to live his failure down? Will he ever become a hero?

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Lord Jim, Pacemaker Classic
author: Joseph Conrad
description:

title: Lost Boy, Lost Girl: Escaping Civil War in the Sudan
author: John Bul Dau
description: Please choose another book from the Library. You will be reading this book in class.

title: Love in Bloom
author: Jennie Abbott
description:
Just then, from behind them, a familiar voice spoke.  "I see you managed pretty well without me," Mike said.
Jeff and Marcie turned around.  Marcie felt a little guilty, but she didn't understand why.  Was it because she had been enjoying herself so much with Jeff?

title: Love in Bloom, Double Fastback
author: Jennie Abbott
description: Just then, from behind them, a familiar voice spoke.  "I see you managed pretty well without me," Mike said. Jeff and Marcie turned around.  Marcie felt a little guilty, but she didn't understand why.  Was it because she had been enjoying herself so much with Jeff?

title: Love of the Subway
author: Quincy Howe
description: When Vesey McCall sees her on the subway, it’s love at first sight.  She smiles at him as she gets off the subway.  But wait! He doesn’t even know her name.  Will Vesey find his mysterious lady love?

title: Love Walked In
author: Santos, Marisa de los
description:
When Martin Grace enters the hip Philadelphia coffee shop that Cornelia Brown manages, Cornelia's life changes forever. Little does she know that her newfound love is a sign of even greater changes to come. Meanwhile, across town, Clare Hobbs, eleven years old and abandoned by her mother, goes looking for her lost father. Her search takes her to Cornelia’s coffee shop, and the two women form an improbable friendship that carries them through the unpredictable currents of love and life.
This first novel by award-winning poet Marisa de los Santos, is bursting with keen insight and beautiful prose. It is an uplifting debut that marks the entrance of an enchanting literary voice.

title: Macbeth, Adapted Classic
author: William Shakespeare
description:
"The Scottish play" as it is often called, is widely considered Shakespeare’s darkest and most bloody tragedy. Full of witches, demons, murders, and madness, it warns that ambition overpowering conscience brings disaster. Macbeth, one of King Duncan’s generals, is told by three witches that he will be king. When Macbeth’s wife finds out, she convinces him to murder Duncan. Macbeth stabs him in his sleep and becomes the new king. After that, Macbeth’s reign becomes a bloodbath. He kills again and again to keep his crown, while Lady Macbeth’s guilt has her wandering the castle every night, seeing horrific visions. What will become of this raving royal couple? How does the fulfillment of one prophecy set in motion a chain of events that lead to the fulfillment of another prophecy.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Many Faces of Masks
author: Welsh, Cassie
description: Masks have been made and used for different purposes for thousands of years. If someone asked you to define mask, what would you say? You might say that a mask is a face covering or disguise worn with costumes at celebrations or parties. You might say that it is something that protects the face during work or in battle. Or you might say it is part of a costume that actors wear. Read this book to find out how masks have been used throughout human history and the roles they have played in almost every culture.

title: Marathon, Fastback
author: Richard Laymon
description: A marathon is 26 miles and 385 yards.  It's the ultimate running test. Just finishing the race is enough for most runners, but not for Rod Claymore.  He's out to win, whatever the cost.

title: March Toward the Thunder
author: Joseph Bruchac
description: Louis Nolette, a 15-year-old Abenaki Indian from Canada, is recruited to fight in the northern Irish Brigade in the American Civil War. Though he is too young, and neither American nor Irish, he finds the promise of good wages and the chance to end slavery persuasive enough reasons to join up. As Louis fights his way through battles, he encounters prejudice and acceptance, strong and weak leadership, cowardice and courage... sometimes in unexpected places.

title: Markers
author: William Warren
description: Shorty is one of the best pool players on the West Coast.  He has a cool head and a deadly bank shot. Can he take down the one man he wants to beat more than anything else in the world?

title: Markers, Fastback
author: William Warren
description: Shorty is one of the best pool players on the West Coast.  He has a cool head and a deadly bank shot. Can he take down the one man he wants to beat more than anything else in the world?

title: Market Treasure Hunt
author: Gail Blasser Riley
description: When Senor Ruiz announces the scavenger hunt at the local market, Lena and Keisha have the chance to win big. But Lena gets nervous in competitions. She really doesn’t want to let Keisha down. Will she choke when the pressure is on? With so much at stake, these two friends find more than they expected when they reach the final clue.

title: Maya Lin: Linking People and Places
author: Scraper, Katherine
description: How would you feel if you were in a national competition? Would you be nervous? Would you be excited? Maya Ying Lin knows how it feels to compete. In 1981, she was a college student studying architecture, the art and science of building. She entered a competition to design a memorial to honor the men and women who had served in the Vietnam War. The memorial would be built in Washington, D.C. Read this book to learn more about Maya Lin and the competition.

title: Meeting at Joe's, Fastback
author: Richard Laymon
description: People in Windville love that old diner at the far end of town.  For them, coming to Joe's is a way of life.  It may soon be a way of death.

title: Memories of President Lincoln
author: Whitman, Walt
description: In this work, you will share the sorrow of the nation when Lincoln is assassinated. Walt Whitman celebrated the wide range of people and experiences that made up America in his lifetime. Experience the stirring inspiration of his words in "O Captain! My Captain!"

title: Mind Grabber, Double Fastback
author: Gary Brandner
description: Hunter Hagedorn is a cop.  He's smart, he's tough, and he deals only in facts.  So when someone tells him that a young hood he saw die is still alive, Hunter finds it impossible to believe.  Soon another dead body turns up, and Hunter finds himself face-to-face with the mind grabber.

title: Miracle's Boys
author: Jacqueline Woodson
description:
If their mama and papa hadn't died, maybe Charlie would still be a loving big brother to 13-year-old Lafayette, not a hostile stranger just back from doing time at a correctional facility. Maybe oldest brother Ty'ree would have gone to college instead of having to work full time to support the three of them. Maybe Lafayette wouldn't need to wonder why Mama had to die, why Charlie hates him so much now, and how they're all supposed to survive these times together, when so much seems to against them.

Jacqueline Woodson brings us the story of three remarkable young brothers.  With only one another to rely on, they must decide whether to come together as a family or let their individual conflicts tear them apart.

title: Mississippi Trial
author: Chris Crowe
description: At first Hiram is excited to visit his hometown in Mississippi. Soon after he arrives, though, he crosses paths with Emmett Till, a black teenager from Chicago who is also visiting for the summer. Hiram sees firsthand how the local whites mistreat blacks who refuse to "know their place." When Emmett's tortured dead body is found floating in a river, Hiram is determined to find out who could do such a thing, but what will it cost him to know? This novel is a gripping read based on true events that helped spark the Civil Rights Movement.

title: Moby Dick, Adapted Classic
author: Melville, Herman
description:
Herman Melville explores the notions of good and evil, obsession, revenge, and madness in this great American novel. The action takes place on a nineteenth-century whaling ship in the Atlantic Ocean. The narrator, a sailor who calls himself Ishmael, joins the crew of the ship and sets out to sea. There, he discovers that the ship’s captain, Ahab, is hardly interested in true whaling. He wants one thing: Moby Dick, the great white whale that destroyed Ahab’s last ship and took his leg. Ahab is obsessed with catching the whale at any cost. Will the entire crew have to pay the price?

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Moby Dick, Pacemaker Classic
author: Herman Melville
description:

title: Mr. Small
author: Fay Robinson
description: Mr. Small has big dreams—he wants to fly like the birds!  What makes them fly? Is it the wings, the feathers, the beak, the nest? Mr. Small tries them all—and he never gives up.  Does he learn to fly or does he achieve something even more amazing? Find out in this story about Mr. Small and his giant heart.

title: My Antonia, Adapted Classic
author: Cather, Willa
description:
When his parents die, Jim is sent by train to live with his grandparents in Nebraska. On the train, he meets a Bohemian immigrant family—including the lively and free-spirited Antonia. Antonia and Jim form a life-long friendship. As narrated by Jim, the novel focuses mostly on different phases of Antonia’s life, her joys and successes as well as her sorrows and losses. Many of Antonia’s experiences reflect experiences in author Willa Cather’s own life. Although primarily about Antonia, the novel is also a celebration of  the families that settled the Nebraska prairie, particularly the strong, vital pioneer women like Antonia and Cather herself. 

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Mysterious Messages: A History of Codes and Ciphers
author: Gary Blackwood
description: This fascinating look at history's most mysterious messages is packed with puzzles to decode and ciphers to solve. The book explores the notes of Spartan warriors, the brilliant code-crackers of Elizabeth I, secret messages of the American Revolution, spy books of the Civil War, the famous Enigma Machine, and the Navajo code talkers. From invisible ink to the CIA, this book provides a hands-on, interactive demonstration of how and why hidden messages have been used over the course of time.

title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
author: Frederick Douglass
description: Please choose another book from the Library. You will be reading this book in class.

title: Narrative of the life of Frederick Douglass, an American Slave, Adapted Classic
author: Frederick Douglass
description:
Around 1818, Frederick Douglass is born into slavery. Every day, he sees the white owners whip, beat, even murder his fellow slaves, without a second thought. When young Frederick realizes the liberating power of reading and writing, he secretly learns how. He even tries to teach other slaves. He refuses to accept a lifetime of slavery and dreams of freedom.  Eventually, Frederick is sent to a “slave-breaker,” who beats and works Frederick so hard, he almost gives up his dream. 
However, years later, Frederick is able to escape to New York City. He marries a free black woman. They move to Massachusetts, where Frederick begins telling his inspirational story to larger and larger audiences. This autobiography was published in 1845 and influenced thousands to join the fight against slavery.

This is an adapted story. Although the text has been altered in some ways, the story is very similar to the original story.

title: Narrative of the life of Frederick Douglass, an American Slave, Pacemaker Classic
